alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Dooly and northeastern Sumter Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near New Era, or 2 miles northeast of Americus, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Byromville, Andersonville, Lilly, Dooling, Drayton, Methvins, New Era, Flint River Wma and Pennington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
